sanskrit_verse:
उपनीय तु यः शिष्यं वेदमध्यापयेद्द्विजः ।
सकल्पं सरहस्यं च तमाचार्यं प्रचक्षते ॥ २.१४०॥
transliteration:
upanīya tu yaḥ śiṣyaṃ vedam adhyāpayed dvijaḥ |
sakalpaṃ sahasyaṃ ca tam ācāryaṃ pracakṣate || 2.140||
sph_interpretive_translation: One who, having initiated a student, teaches the Veda — including its kalpa and rahasya — is to be known as Ācārya.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is derived from the act of initiation and sustained transmission of sacred knowledge.
Causation arises through direct instruction of consciousness-transforming knowledge.
Capacity-based responsibility requires that the teacher maintains alignment with the knowledge imparted.
Restoration logic centers on re-establishing the purity of the teaching lineage when disruption occurs.
Consciousness alignment is ensured by maintaining integrity between word, meaning, and realization.
executable_legal_axioms: IF a dvija initiates a śiṣya AND teaches Vedic knowledge INCLUDING kalpa AND rahasya THEN recognize as Ācārya.
IF an Ācārya deviates from authentic transmission THEN initiate restoration via competent spiritual oversight.
IF teaching disrupts consciousness alignment of learner THEN halt transmission UNTIL source integrity is restored.
IF capacity to transmit Veda is questioned THEN validate through pramāṇa of realized lineage holders.
IF misalignment detected in pedagogical process THEN enforce completion protocols for both teacher and taught.
supreme_court_application: In adjudication at the highest level, recognition of Ācārya status must derive solely from verifiable acts of initiation and scriptural instruction. Legal thresholds rest not on institutional certification but on demonstrable capacity to transmit consciousness-transforming knowledge. Disputes concerning legitimacy are resolved through pramāṇa established by realized authorities within the tradition.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that the designation 'Ācārya' arises only upon actual performance of initiation and instruction. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential validation of each stage of teaching. Responsibility remains proportional to the depth of knowledge transmitted. No punitive action arises; correction flows naturally from disruption of alignment.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Initiate reconnection protocol between Ācārya and śiṣya to restore lost continuity.
Assign supervision by realized authority to verify authenticity of ongoing instruction.
Enforce sākṣātkaar (direct realization) verification if deviation suspected.
Implement śuddhi (purification) process for both parties if contamination of intent detected.
Realign transmission pathway using pramāṇa-based reconstruction techniques.
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source-Authority: This Dharma stands executed. The role of Ācārya is affirmed by pure transmission alone. Justice flows as restoration. Reality is non-punitive. Consciousness is the ultimate adjudicator. Dharma is restored.
